channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 8th January
item.description:
Customer reports that residents are unhappy about the temporary 3-way TS at the location, which are in place for a delivery. Ostensibly, there is nothing going on and road users feel they should be removed, if this indeed the case, to free up the road for traffic. Please can they be updated asap.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Fly tipping of toilet, 8th January
item.description:
There is a broken porcelain toilet pan thrown into the hedge from the field behind house's in holmer crescent ( roughly behind no's 28/29.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Holmer Crescent, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 8th January
item.description:
Following the closure of part of the Honeybourne cycle/pedestrian path several weeks ago, the sign used has not been collected. It is on the path which crosses the bridge over Swindon Road.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

Outside 5 Cowper road

item.title: Do NOT fell tree please, 8th January
item.description:
Locals have said the conifer on Church Road, Churchdown is not safe. But it appears safe and has high amenity value, being very visible and enhances the street scene. Please do NOT fell! It is privately owned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temp lights by Hare & Hounds junction, 8th January
item.description:
The timings of these temp lights need to be looked at ASAP! Going towards Churchdown traffic is unable to go on green due to opposite traffic Going towards Innsworth being on red at Hare and Hounds lights. This is causing major issues in the mornings and 3pm onwards. You need to sort - thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: VAS Not Working Correctly, 8th January
item.description:
Since the flag has been added to the lamp post, the VAS vehicle activated speed indicator is no longer clearly visible to approaching drivers, which undermines its purpose. Please can this be investigated ASAP with the relevant team so flag is removed and any damage to the VAS repaired so the sign is made fully visible again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Two Hedges Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign isn't working correctly (part only or random activation)

item.title: 5 streetlights out on Pittville Circus, 7th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Pittville Circus, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Whole western side of road is failing, 7th January
item.description:
The whole side of the road is failing as vehicles try to pass each other. The road is not up to the increasing amounts of traffic using it from the nearby housing developments. Another example of GCC failing to ensure infrastructure is up to the increased demands of new housing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cleeve Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
